					Wake County Drug Crimes Defense Lawyers
				
				
			
				
				
				
				
				
			
				
				
				
				
				Attorneys for Clients Charged With Drug Possession and Other Offenses in Raleigh and Smithfield, NC
Since the mid-1970s, combating the possession, distribution, and use of illegal drugs has been a high priority for national, state, and local law enforcement agencies. In 1971, President Richard Nixon officially declared “war on drugs,” and in the years that followed, those convicted of drug-related offenses faced increasingly harsh consequences. Today, attitudes regarding some drugs, including marijuana, have relaxed somewhat, but other drugs such as heroin and crack cocaine continue to cause problems in many communities. 
At the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, our attorneys are fully aware that a single drug-related conviction can change your life forever. You could face penalties that include jail time, probation, expensive fines, and a mark on your criminal record that will follow you for the rest of your life. If you are facing any type of misdemeanor or felony drug charges, we are ready to help you. With more than 35 years of combined experience, our lawyers know how to get results, and we will work hard to ensure that your rights and your future are fully protected. 
Trusted North Carolina Criminal Defense Counsel
In nearly every drug-related case, the severity of the charges will depend on the type and amount of the drug in question. Your previous criminal record will also be taken into account. Under North Carolina law, drug charges can range from misdemeanor charges for the possession of marijuana or drug paraphernalia up to felony charges for trafficking of so-called “hard” drugs such as heroin and methamphetamines. It is important to understand, however, that there is no such thing as a minor drug case in North Carolina. A drug-related criminal charge is always serious, and you should have a qualified attorney at your side. 
At the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, our knowledgeable criminal defense lawyers can help you build a defense against whatever drug charges you may be facing, including:

Possession of an illegal drug
Possession with intent to sell or distribute
Trafficking and distribution
Manufacturing a controlled substance
Prescription drug fraud and illegal possession
Marijuana-related offenses

The skilled attorneys at our firm have the experience and resources to fully analyze the circumstances surrounding your arrest and to build a case to help you avoid a conviction. Our team has successfully represented many clients facing drug charges, and we are ready to put our client-first approach to work for you.  
Charlotte Drug Crime Lawyers Protecting Your Constitutional Rights
The prosecution of a drug crime case is usually dependent on the physical evidence obtained by the police before an arrest is made. Such evidence often includes the drug itself, along with paraphernalia or supplies that could suggest an intent to sell. The Fourth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution provides protection for citizens against unlawful searches and seizures, but illegal searches are not uncommon. If the evidence against you was found during an unlawful search of your home, car, or personal effects, our lawyers will work to get your charges reduced or dismissed altogether.
When you choose to work with the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, you become part of a team that is dedicated to protecting your best interests. In order to do so, we pledge to be honest with you about your case, even when the truth is not easy to hear. For example, we recognize that in certain situations, your best option may be to negotiate with prosecutors to secure a plea deal that minimizes the impact on your future. Depending on the nature and the severity of the charges, you may be eligible for diversion programs or other alternatives that could allow you to avoid having a conviction on your permanent record. When appropriate, however, we are fully prepared to defend your innocence at trial. No matter how challenging your case may be, you can depend on us to remain at your side every step of the way. 
Contact Our Office Today
Penalties for a drug conviction can range from fines and probation up to decades in prison, so it is crucial to have an experienced North Carolina drug crime defense attorney on your side. If you or someone you love is facing drug charges, contact our office. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO or 919-626-8450 to schedule a free, no-obligation consultation with one of our attorneys today. Our law firm serves clients in Smithfield, Charlotte, Raleigh, Wake County, Johnston County, Mecklenburg County, and the surrounding areas. mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

				FollowFollowFollow
			
			
				
				
				
				
			
				
				
					
	
	
	
    
    
			
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
				
					Wake County Drug Crimes Defense Lawyers
				
				
			
				
				
				
				
				
			
				
				
				
				
				Attorneys for Clients Charged With Drug Possession and Other Offenses in Raleigh and Smithfield, NC
Since the mid-1970s, combating the possession, distribution, and use of illegal drugs has been a high priority for national, state, and local law enforcement agencies. In 1971, President Richard Nixon officially declared “war on drugs,” and in the years that followed, those convicted of drug-related offenses faced increasingly harsh consequences. Today, attitudes regarding some drugs, including marijuana, have relaxed somewhat, but other drugs such as heroin and crack cocaine continue to cause problems in many communities. 
At the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, our attorneys are fully aware that a single drug-related conviction can change your life forever. You could face penalties that include jail time, probation, expensive fines, and a mark on your criminal record that will follow you for the rest of your life. If you are facing any type of misdemeanor or felony drug charges, we are ready to help you. With more than 35 years of combined experience, our lawyers know how to get results, and we will work hard to ensure that your rights and your future are fully protected. 
Trusted North Carolina Criminal Defense Counsel
In nearly every drug-related case, the severity of the charges will depend on the type and amount of the drug in question. Your previous criminal record will also be taken into account. Under North Carolina law, drug charges can range from misdemeanor charges for the possession of marijuana or drug paraphernalia up to felony charges for trafficking of so-called “hard” drugs such as heroin and methamphetamines. It is important to understand, however, that there is no such thing as a minor drug case in North Carolina. A drug-related criminal charge is always serious, and you should have a qualified attorney at your side. 
At the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, our knowledgeable criminal defense lawyers can help you build a defense against whatever drug charges you may be facing, including:

Possession of an illegal drug
Possession with intent to sell or distribute
Trafficking and distribution
Manufacturing a controlled substance
Prescription drug fraud and illegal possession
Marijuana-related offenses

The skilled attorneys at our firm have the experience and resources to fully analyze the circumstances surrounding your arrest and to build a case to help you avoid a conviction. Our team has successfully represented many clients facing drug charges, and we are ready to put our client-first approach to work for you.  
Charlotte Drug Crime Lawyers Protecting Your Constitutional Rights
The prosecution of a drug crime case is usually dependent on the physical evidence obtained by the police before an arrest is made. Such evidence often includes the drug itself, along with paraphernalia or supplies that could suggest an intent to sell. The Fourth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution provides protection for citizens against unlawful searches and seizures, but illegal searches are not uncommon. If the evidence against you was found during an unlawful search of your home, car, or personal effects, our lawyers will work to get your charges reduced or dismissed altogether.
When you choose to work with the Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC, you become part of a team that is dedicated to protecting your best interests. In order to do so, we pledge to be honest with you about your case, even when the truth is not easy to hear. For example, we recognize that in certain situations, your best option may be to negotiate with prosecutors to secure a plea deal that minimizes the impact on your future. Depending on the nature and the severity of the charges, you may be eligible for diversion programs or other alternatives that could allow you to avoid having a conviction on your permanent record. When appropriate, however, we are fully prepared to defend your innocence at trial. No matter how challenging your case may be, you can depend on us to remain at your side every step of the way. 
Contact Our Office Today
Penalties for a drug conviction can range from fines and probation up to decades in prison, so it is crucial to have an experienced North Carolina drug crime defense attorney on your side. If you or someone you love is facing drug charges, contact our office. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO or 919-626-8450 to schedule a free, no-obligation consultation with one of our attorneys today. Our law firm serves clients in Smithfield, Charlotte, Raleigh, Wake County, Johnston County, Mecklenburg County, and the surrounding areas. cta.urgency: Don't wait - immigration laws are changing. Call now!

faqs.question: How long does the immigration process take?
faqs.answer: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

faqs.question: Do I need an immigration lawyer?
faqs.answer: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

faqs.question: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?
faqs.answer: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.
